title: Shenzhou-17 astronauts conduct first spacewalk to repair solar array
summary: China’s Shenzhou-17 astronauts embarked on their first extravehicular activity Thursday to address minor damage to a Tiangong space station solar array.

title: Rocket Report: Vulcan stacked for launch; Starship aces test ahead of third flight
summary: "We look forward to flying our next crewed flight soon."

title: ESA Will Award up to Three Phase 1 LEO Cargo Return Contracts
summary:
The European Space Agency has published a call for companies interested in submitting proposals for the agency’s LEO Cargo Return Service initiative. The call reveals that the agency plans to award as many as three Phase 1 contracts that would allow companies to mature their respective vehicle designs. ESA’s LEO Cargo Return Service initiative was […]
The post ESA Will Award up to Three Phase 1 LEO Cargo Return Contracts appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: 1,000 sols into their mission, Perseverance and Ingenuity continue to investigate Jezero Crater
summary: After celebrating their 1,000th sol, or Martian day, on Mars, NASA’s Perseverance rover and Ingenuity helicopter are continuing to explore Jezero Crater on the Red Planet. Recently, the robotic pair completed their extensive investigation of the ancient river delta within Jezero, which contains evidence of flowing water that may have once filled Jezero thousands of years ago.

title: VP Harris Lays Out Cooperative Policy Roadmap
summary: At the National Space Council meeting on December 20, 2023, Vice President Kamala Harris and her advisors announced that the Artemis Program will land an international astronaut on the moon “before the end of the decade.” This announcement came alongside several new initiatives and frameworks for international cooperation, highlighting the collaborative nature of the American space industry.
